div.p: We are sending an Englishman with a cloak to you; we will also come ourselves if we hear that he is alive. Therefore, so that we might know more quickly, it pleased us to send this swift messenger ahead with a hired horse; for it was not permitted to hire more. I ask that you order him to hasten back to us if Frensham is alive.
A cloak will be more easily and closely obtainable for you in Aarau, if needed. May the Lord Jesus, the source of all salvation, keep us for His glory!
May 6, that is, the day after your letter was delivered here. Basel.
To the most learned man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, in ZÃ¼rich.
